Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Sugammadex Dosing in Morbidly Obese Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: Eight randomised controlled trials (RCTs) involving 645 participants were included.

Participants.evidence: Participants were MO patients undergoing bariatric surgery.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention was sugammadex dosing based on different weight scalars: total body weight (TBW), ideal body weight (IBW), 20% corrected body weight (CBW), and 40% CBW.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was recovery time from moderate or deep NMB, measured by the time to a Train of Four (TOF) ratio of 0.9.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation methods and allocation concealment varied across studies

Number_Randomised.evidence: Eight randomised controlled trials (RCTs) involving 645 participants were included.

Result_Outcome.evidence: A dose of 2 mg/kg of sugammadex based on 40% CBW and a 4 mg/kg dose based on 40% CBW provided reliable and timely reversal of moderate and deep NMB, respectively.

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.
